newsitem.title: USA: US debt futures weaken on U.S. durable goods data.
newsitem.headline: US debt futures weaken on U.S. durable goods data.

text.p: U.S. debt futures weakened in reaction to the surprising 1.6-percent rise in U.S. durable goods orders for July, but losses were contained within ranges, traders and analysts said.
"It's funny how quickly the buyers came back in," one Eurodollar futures floor source said. "I thought March Eurodollars EDH7 would at least test 94.00."

However, March did dip below 94.05, the lower end of the contract's 15-day range. December Eurodollars eased to 94.17, still within its own 15-day range which is capped on the downside at the August 15 low of 94.16.
The upper-end of the 15-day range is at the August 13 high of 94.28.
"The fact December fell through 94.17 to 94.18 has no significance whatsoever," another Eurodollar trader said.
While one large commission firm sold 2,000 March Eurodollars at the day's low of 94.04, he remained positive on the market.
"Once March takes out 93.97, it's off to the races because people will start covering their positions," he said. "It will just be a great buying opportunity."
September T-bonds, meanwhile, flirted around the 110-00 area due to bond options exercise around 1200 CDT/1700 GMT.
Traders said open interest was equally weighted in both September bond 110-00 put and 110-00 call options.

If the contract dipped much below the 109-28/32 level, the intraday low, further selling pressure would be exerted. But so far, traders are impressed September held above the four-month support level of 109-24/32.
Opening weakness was largely attributed to declines in the German bund market, which failed to sustain Thursday's rally.
Soon after the opening, one firm sold 1,000 September contracts, while another small brokerage house was seen selling selling 2,000 contracts.

The selling pressure at the outset of pit trade pushed September bonds to the three-week low of 110-09/32, which was set on Thursday. The contract then tested 110-05/32, which is a one-third Fibonacci retracement level from the two-month high.

After the report released, the bond market was poised for a further slide. September bonds fell to 110-00 after one foreign-based firm sold 2,000 to 3,000 contracts. In addition, one large firm has sold 5,000 contracts all morning.

At 0940 CDT/1440 GMT, September T-bonds were down 22/32 at 109-28/32, December Eurodollars were down four basis points at 94.18, March Eurodollars were down seven basis points at 94.03, 10-year notes were down 14/32 at 106-29/32 and munibonds were up 24/32 at 114-24/32.
